story:
Once upon a time, in a peaceful valley nestled in the heart of Afghanistan, there was a small village known as Balahissar. This village was home to a kind and gentle boy named Zal, who lived with his father, a wise and respected elder named Khosrow.

Zal was known throughout the valley for his boundless curiosity and his love of nature. He spent his days exploring the rolling hills and crystal-clear streams, always marveling at the beauty of the world around him.

One day, as Zal was wandering near the edge of the village, he stumbled upon a hidden cave. Curiosity piqued, he ventured inside, only to discover a magnificent bird with shimmering feathers of gold and silver.

The bird was unlike anything Zal had ever seen before. Its eyes sparkled like sapphires, and its song filled the air with music that was both soothing and invigorating.

As Zal approached the bird, it spoke to him in a gentle, melodic voice. "Greetings, young one," it said. "I am the Simurgh, a magical bird from a land far, far away. I have been sent here to grant you three wishes, for you are a kind and pure-hearted soul."

Zal could hardly believe his ears. He had heard stories of magical birds and genies who granted wishes, but he never thought he would actually encounter one.

After thinking for a moment, Zal decided to use his first wish to ask for an endless supply of food for his family and the villagers of Balahissar. With a graceful wave of its wings, the Simurgh granted the wish, and the valley became a veritable paradise, filled with lush gardens and an abundance of fruit, vegetables, and grain.

With his second wish, Zal asked for healing powers to help anyone in the village who was sick or injured. Once again, the Simurgh granted the wish, and Zal became a beloved figure in the village, using his newfound gifts to heal the sick and injured, and bring happiness and joy to all who lived there.

Finally, with his third and final wish, Zal asked for something truly extraordinary: the power to speak to animals and understand their thoughts and feelings. The Simurgh smiled and granted this wish as well, and from that day forward, Zal could communicate with all the creatures of the forest, from the tiniest ant to the mightiest lion.

Years passed, and Zal grew up to be a wise and just leader, using his powers to protect the village and its inhabitants from harm. And whenever he needed guidance, he would consult with the Simurgh, who remained his constant companion and friend.

And so, Zal and the people of Balahissar lived in harmony and happiness, always grateful for the magical bird that had brought so much joy and prosperity to their lives.

As you drift off to sleep, dear son, remember the story of Zal and the Simurgh, and let it inspire you to always be kind, curious, and filled with wonder for the world around you. Goodnight, and sweet dreams.
